This is Katherine McShane interviewing Guy Harper for the Swicker Cardiff Carnival 25th
Anniversary Project. The date is the 12th of November 2014 and we're here in Penilan
in Cardiff and Guy for the recording. Could you spell your name for me please?
G for gorilla, U for an umbrella and Y for yacht. And your second name? John or Harper.
Yeah Harper. Sorry, H-A-R-P-E-R. Lovely. So can you remember how you got involved in
carnival in the first place? Yeah I got dragged along. I was doing some voluntary work for
City Centre Youth Project and some people I'd met there. I think it was a young lady called Karen
and a chap called Steph and a young lady called Jane dragged me along. They said to come along
to this... well I think they'd been before. They said, oh it's carnival's on, you've got to come
along. So I went along and there's lots of dremming and I was quite interested in music anyway.
So they were doing lots of sort of, I don't know, the equivalent of like samba drumming.
I'm not that knowledgeable so I don't know what particular style it was but I just wanted to do
a bit of drumming and there were lots of people drumming in a big space and I thought yeah you
know I like this and then they started making costumes and stuff. So I got involved and then
carried on going for a few consecutive years. Can you remember which period that was?
What do you mean which period? In terms of years. Well as we were saying earlier, I seem to think it would have been

I would have carried on going until at least 96 I think. Okay and what was it that sort of kept you
